instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2485: What is A2485? A2485 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3651, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02100, 820-02382..

threads.title: "One more thing" - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP 16" - 2021 - Lid angle sensor
threads.message:
Hey guys,

the lid angle sensor is corroded. Disconnected the sensor - everything´s starting up and fine.

Is there a fix without Apple? Can i move the chip (when its alive) to a new cable and everything´s works fine? Or it needs to be calibrated by Apple´s Software?

This awesome rocket-science sensor is paired to the board, right?

What functionality is lost, when i just disconnect the cable? Can it be wake up and sleep manually?
